This is where you select a quest and form an adventuring party of four heroes to embark on it.
{colour_start|notable}[SELECT]{colour_end} quests with {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to see their details.
Place heroes into slots at the bottom of the screen to form your party by holding{colour_start|notable}[RT]{colour_end} and using the {colour_start|notable}[A BUTTON]{colour_end}.

You'll need to {colour_start|notable}recruit all of these heroes{colour_end} to fill out a party of four.
Select each hero with {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK] plus [A BUTTON]{colour_end} and then use {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK] plus [A BUTTON]{colour_end} again to place the hero in your active roster on the right.

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to town{colour_end} at any time--just press {colour_start|notable}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[B BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

When a hero is selected, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[X BUTTON]{colour_end} to bring up a detailed panel showing all of the hero's {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}, {colour_start|notable}skills{colour_end}, and {colour_start|notable}resistances{colour_end}.

On any screen in the game, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[View]{colour_end} to see contextual help.
Try it while in town, exploring, fighting, camping, and more.

Combat is {colour_start|notable}turn-based{colour_end}. On your hero's turn, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SELECT]{colour_end} a skill icon and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SELECT]{colour_end} a target.
If you can't select a particular skill, it's because that hero needs to be {colour_start|notable}standing in a different spot{colour_end} or there are {colour_start|notable}no valid targets{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[HIGHLIGHT]{colour_end} the skill to see the requirements.

You are currently in a {colour_start|notable}room{colour_end}.
To move towards another room, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to select a {colour_start|notable}destination room{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}map{colour_end}. This will take you to the {colour_start|notable}connecting hallway{colour_end}.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[B BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

While in a {colour_start|notable}hallway{colour_end}, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to move forward or backward.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[B BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

While exploring, you will often find {colour_start|notable}interactive objects{colour_end}. Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to investigate them with the active hero. Take a look at this tent...
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[B BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

Your hero is {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleeding{colour_end}!
If you wish, you can use a {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} from inventory to stop the flow. Select the bandage and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end} to use it when it's the injured hero's turn.

Select and use Anti-Venom, Bandages, or Medicinal Herbs from inventory with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end} to heal BLIGHT, BLEED, or DEBUFFS on the current hero, respectively.

The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level greatly affects many mechanics{colour_end} in the game. The darker it gets, the harder things get but the better the rewards. Select a torch in inventory and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end} to consume it and boost the light back up.

This quest involves {colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} and Camping requires {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end}. Firewood is {colour_start|notable}given automatically{colour_end} to you on appropriate quests.
{colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} gives heroes a chance to {colour_start|notable}recuperate while in the dungeon{colour_end}. When you are wounded or stressed and wish to camp, select firewood in your inventory and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end}.

Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} while near the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}.
When heroes are within range of a scouted trap, the trap icon will show up in their status bars.
Some heroes are better than others at disarming.
To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

Each hero has slots to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just select the trinket in inventory and press {colour_start|notable}[A BUTTON] {colour_end} to equip it. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also restricted to one hero class.

You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory with {colour_start|notable}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end}, select a trinket you don't want, and then sell it with [X BUTTON].

A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Secret Room{colour_end}! Advance to the tile marked with a star, and press {colour_start|notable}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to enter. Fabulous wealth and riches await those equipped with a {colour_start|notable}key{colour_end}...

Select a hero with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RT plus LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and then press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[X BUTTON]{colour_end} to inspect their character sheet. Skills can be selected, clothing color can be changed, and they can be renamed or dismissed permanently.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L STICK and A BUTTON]{colour_end} to enter buildings.
STAGECOACH: recruit new heroes
BLACKSMITH, GUILD, SURVIVALIST: upgrade hero skills and equipment
TAVERN, ABBEY: send heroes for {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief
SANITARIUM: treat heroes' quirks and diseases
NOMAD'S WAGON: purchase rare items
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} when ready to {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}EMBARK ON A QUEST{colour_end}.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
With a hero selected, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[X BUTTON]{colour_end} to inspect them.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to hire and place new heroes into your roster.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Blacksmith slot to see their weapon and armor upgrade options.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} upgrades and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Blacksmith before purchasing certain hero upgrades.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Guild to see their skill upgrade options.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} combat skills or combat skill upgrades and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Guild before purchasing certain hero upgrades.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Survivalist to see their Camping skill upgrade options.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} skills or upgrades and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Survivalist before purchasing certain hero upgrades.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the appropriate slot and confirm payment with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to begin a stress-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.

Select an unoccupied building slot and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not be refunded the money spent.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the appropriate slot and confirm payment with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to begin a stress-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.

Select an unoccupied building slot and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not be refunded the money spent.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.

Treating quirks: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero into a treatment ward slot and select a positive quirk to reinforce and/or a negative quirk to remove. Severe quirks cost more to remove.
Treating diseases: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero into a medical ward slot and select a disease to treat. Sometimes extra diseases will also be cured.
Committing the hero to treatment will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional treatment slots.

Select an unoccupied building slot and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not be refunded the money spent.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} an available item and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase it.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} available quests to inspect them.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} heroes and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to add them into the adventuring party.
Heroes that are in the Tavern, Abbey, or Sanitarium will be unavailable for use.
Complete quests in regions to advance your Mastery in that region and open up new quest types.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} when ready to proceed to Provisioning.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} items in the shop and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them for the expedition.
At quest end, unused provisions will be discarded without repayment. Buy only as much as you need!
You'll always want to carry some food and torches! Each hero generally eats 1 food unit per meal (Camping or Hunger event) and even on short quests you'll want at least 8 torches.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to choose a new room destination and enter the connecting hallway.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RB and LB]{colour_end} to change active hero.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[UP BUTTON and DOWN BUTTON]{colour_end} to toggle between INVENTORY and MAP.

Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to move a hero within the party. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Hold A BUTTON]{colour_end} to restore default order.
To start CAMPING, select firewood in inventory (if you have any) and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end}.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to view gameplay effects like light level and hero status conditions.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to abandon the quest and return to the Hamlet.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RT]{colour_end} to access map controls.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[X BUTTON]{colour_end} to see a hero's detailed character sheet.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to walk forward or backward.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to enter doors.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[UP BUTTON and DOWN BUTTON]{colour_end} to toggle between INVENTORY and MAP.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RB and LB]{colour_end} to change hero selection.

Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to move a hero within the party. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Hold A BUTTON]{colour_end} to restore default order.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to view gameplay effects like light level and hero status conditions.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RT]{colour_end} to access map controls.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to abandon the quest and return to the Hamlet.

On hero's turn, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to select a valid combat skill and then a target.

Each skill has requirements for where the hero needs to be standing and what enemies they can target. Select a skill with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to see the requirements.

When selecting a target with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end}, you can see that enemy's stats and the hero's chance to hit / damage values with the currently selected skill.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[X BUTTON]{colour_end} to see a hero's detailed character sheet.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} to view current light level and hero / monster status effects.

Select and use Anti-Venom, Bandages, or Medicinal Herbs from inventory with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end} to heal BLIGHT, BLEED, or DEBUFFS on the current hero, respectively.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to highlight a meal option and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to eat. You are limited by how much food you have in inventory.
Your party has {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[12 RESPITE POINTS]{colour_end} to spend on using Camping skills.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LB and RB]{colour_end} to select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK and A BUTTON]{colour_end} to use a skill. Some skills require a target to be selected.
When done spending RESPITE POINTS, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Y BUTTON]{colour_end} to finish camping.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to select a destination room on the map.
Hold [LT] and press [B BUTTON] to reduce torchlight.
Hold [LT] and press [B BUTTON] repeatedly to snuff out the torch.
Place a hero here.
Your save file appears to have been corrupted. Estate cannot be loaded.
Press [A BUTTON] to dismiss hero word balloons.
[Hold] Unequip
[Hold Y BUTTON] to discard an item.
[A BUTTON] to commit hero for treatment.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A BUTTON]{colour_end} to recruit into roster.
[A BUTTON] to commit hero for treatment.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[ANY BUTTON]{colour_end} to Continue
Select the letter to begin...
Trinkets
Required DLC is missing.
Hold {colour_start|notable}[LT]{colour_end} to see details about torchlight, combat status, inventory items, and more!
Hold {colour_start|notable}[LT]{colour_end} to see details about torchlight, combat status, inventory items, and more!
Hold {colour_start|notable}[LT]{colour_end} to see details about torchlight, combat status, inventory items, and more!
Hold {colour_start|notable}[LT]{colour_end} to see details about torchlight, combat status, inventory items, and more!
Hold {colour_start|notable}[LT]{colour_end} to see details about torchlight, combat status, inventory items, and more!
Press {colour_start|notable}[View]{colour_end} on any screen to get context-sensitive HELP!
Press {colour_start|notable}[View]{colour_end} on any screen to get context-sensitive HELP!
Press {colour_start|notable}[View]{colour_end} on any screen to get context-sensitive HELP!
Press {colour_start|notable}[View]{colour_end} on any screen to get context-sensitive HELP!
Press {colour_start|notable}[View]{colour_end} on any screen to get context-sensitive HELP!
Did you know there is a Glossary in the {colour_start|notable}Options Menu{colour_end}?
Did you know there is a Glossary in the {colour_start|notable}Options Menu{colour_end}?
Did you know there is a Glossary in the {colour_start|notable}Options Menu{colour_end}?
Did you know there is a Glossary in the {colour_start|notable}Options Menu{colour_end}?
Did you know there is a Glossary in the {colour_start|notable}Options Menu{colour_end}?
Save and Exit

Darkest Dungeon is about making the most of a bad situation. Quests will fail or must be abandoned. Heroes will die. And when they die, they stay dead. Progress autosaves frequently, so actions are permanent.

While in dungeons, holding LT Button is required before you can swap hero positions, change hero selection, or view character sheets. Turn this on if you frequently start swapping a hero's position when you didn't intend to.
Use D-Pad Left and D-Pad Right Buttons in Dungeon
While walking in dungeons, use D-Pad Left and D-Pad Right Buttons for hero swapping instead of LB and RB Buttons.
Interact with L Stick Up
While in dungeons, pressing up on L Stick can be used to enter doors, open curios, and similar actions. (This duplicates A Button functionality.)
Sell back with [A BUTTON]

Each item, if you take it, will occupy space in your inventory.
Hold {colour_start|notable}[LT] and use [LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to show details about the items available to loot. This works in your inventory, too!
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[B BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)
In the Hamlet
In the Darkest Dungeon
In the Cove
In the Ruins
In the Weald
In the Warrens
In Menus
Switch Profile
Press any button to start.
Stress Gained
Heirlooms Collected
Graveyard Count

While you're here, spend some of your starting heirlooms on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Stagecoach Network{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LT]{colour_end} and select the upgrade with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK] and [A BUTTON]{colour_end}.

There isn't much more you can do in town right now. It's time to EMBARK on a quest!
Press {colour_start|notable}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to embark!
